docs.title: AI Workspace Template
docs.text: A meta-repository template that aggregates related repositories using git submodules, creating a unified workspace for AI agents to operate across your project ecosystem.

docs.title: What This Template Provides
docs.text:
• Unified workspace — Bring multiple repositories together under one roof with git submodules
  • Agent-ready documentation — Modular docs system (agent-docs/) optimized for AI consumption
  • Reusable skills and commands — Cross-tool agent capabilities that work with Claude Code, OpenCode, Cursor, and Roo Code
  • Automatic session sync — Submodules stay up-to-date when AI tool sessions start
  • Tool discovery — Automatically detects installed CLI tools and injects them into agent context
  • Pre-commit automation — Workspace alignment, validation, and distribution handled automatically

docs.title: CI Recommendations
docs.text: This template does not ship CI workflows for template users, since teams use different CI systems (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, etc.). Below are recommended CI steps and example configurations.

docs.title: Recommended CI Steps
docs.text:
1. Install dependencies — uv sync
  2. Run pre-commit checks — uv run pre-commit run --all-files
  3. Run session-start script (optional) — uv run python .ai-workspace/scripts/session-start.py as a smoke test

docs.title: GitHub Actions Example
docs.text:
name: ci
on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

jobs:
  check:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          submodules: recursive
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v6
      - run: uv sync
      - run: uv run pre-commit run --all-files

docs.title: GitLab CI Example
docs.text:
check:
  image: python:3.12
  before_script:
    - pip install uv
    - uv sync
    - git submodule update --init --recursive
  script:
    - uv run pre-commit run --all-files

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
The workspace is configured via ai-workspace.toml at the repository root.

A JSON Schema is auto-generated at .ai-workspace/schema.json for editor autocomplete.

docs.title: [workspace]
docs.text: Key Type Default Description name string "AI Workspace" Workspace display name

docs.title: [sync]
docs.text: Key Type Default Description skip_on_uncommitted_changes bool true Skip submodules with uncommitted changes during sync (false = fail) default_branch string "main" Fallback branch if not specified in .gitmodules template_upstream_url string (template URL) URL for template update notifications. Set empty to disable. template_upstream_git_remote string "template-upstream" Git remote name for the template upstream

docs.title: [hooks.session_start]
docs.text: Key Type Default Description script string (required) Path to the script to run at session start timeout int 120 Timeout in seconds

docs.title: [features]
docs.text: Key Type Default Description skills bool true Enable the skills system commands bool true Enable the commands system agent_docs bool true Enable the agent-docs system

docs.title: [tools]
docs.text: Key Type Default Description show_unavailable bool false Show all defined tools with availability status, or only available ones

docs.title: [distribution]
docs.text: Key Type Default Description skills_paths list[str] [".opencode/skill"] Target directories for skills symlinks commands_paths list[str] (IDE dirs) Target directories for commands

docs.title: Example Configuration
docs.text:
[workspace]
name = "AI Workspace"

[sync]
skip_on_uncommitted_changes = true
default_branch = "main"
template_upstream_url = "https://github.com/MichaelYochpaz/ai-workspace-template.git"
template_upstream_git_remote = "template-upstream"

[hooks.session_start]
script = ".ai-workspace/scripts/session-start.py"
timeout = 120

[features]
skills = true
commands = true
agent_docs = true

[tools]
show_unavailable = false

[distribution]
skills_paths = [".opencode/skill"]
commands_paths = [
    ".roo/commands",
    ".claude/commands",
    ".cursor/commands",
    ".opencode/command",
]

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.11+
  • uv — Python package manager
  • Git

docs.title: 1. Create Your Repository
docs.text: Use the "Use this template" button on GitHub, or clone the repository directly.

docs.title: 2. Initialize Submodules
docs.text: git submodule update --init --recursive

docs.title: 3. Install Dependencies
docs.text: uv sync

docs.title: 4. Install Pre-commit Hooks
docs.text: uv run pre-commit install

docs.title: Adding a Submodule
docs.text: git submodule add <repository-url> repositories/<name>

docs.title: Verifying Your Setup
docs.text:
# Run session sync manually
uv run .ai-workspace/scripts/session-start.py

# Verify pre-commit hooks
uv run pre-commit run --all-files

docs.title: Agent Docs
docs.text: Agent Docs are modular, task-focused documentation files optimized for AI agent consumption. They provide context and instructions that agents read when performing specific tasks.

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
agent-docs/
└── <topic>/
    ├── metadata.yaml    # Discovery metadata
    └── <topic>.md       # Documentation content

docs.title: 1. Create the Directory
docs.text: mkdir -p agent-docs/<topic>

docs.title: 2. Write metadata.yaml
docs.text:
name: My Documentation
description: |
  What this doc covers and what problems it solves.
when_to_read: |
  When performing X tasks or encountering Y situations.

docs.title: 3. Write the Documentation
docs.text: Create agent-docs/<topic>/<topic>.md with the documentation content.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Keep documents focused on a single topic
  • Use generic examples with placeholders instead of version-specific content
  • Structure content with clear headings for scannability
  • Include concrete commands and file paths
  • Verify accuracy by reading source code before writing

docs.title: Commands
docs.text: Commands are reusable AI prompts invoked by users (e.g., /my-command) and executed by AI agents. They work across multiple tools through a "superset frontmatter" pattern.

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
commands/
└── <command-name>/
    └── command.md    # Frontmatter + prompt content

docs.title: Superset Frontmatter
docs.text:
---
# Universal
description: "Brief description for UI menus"

# Roo Code
argument-hint: "<optional_argument>"

# Claude Code
allowed-tools: ["read_file", "list_files"]

# Cursor
globs: ["**/*.ts", "**/*.tsx"]
alwaysApply: false
---

docs.title: Distribution
docs.text: uv run .ai-workspace/scripts/transpile-commands.py

docs.title: Supported Tools
docs.text: Tool Distribution Notes Claude Code Symlink Ignores unknown YAML keys Cursor Transpile Frontmatter stripped to avoid issues OpenCode Symlink Uses .opencode/command/ (singular) Roo Code Symlink Ignores unknown YAML keys

docs.title: Skills
docs.text: Skills are reusable agent capabilities following the Agent Skills specification. They provide structured instructions and scripts that agents load on-demand when user requests match.

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
skills/
└── <skill-name>/
    ├── SKILL.md           # Required: Frontmatter + instructions
    ├── scripts/           # Optional: Executable scripts
    ├── tests/             # Optional: Test files
    ├── references/        # Optional: Additional documentation
    └── assets/            # Optional: Templates, data files

docs.title: SKILL.md Format
docs.text:
---
name: my-skill
description: Action + object + context. Use when X, Y, or Z.
allowed-tools: Bash(python:*) Bash(uv:*) Read
---

# My Skill

Instructions for the agent...

docs.title: Frontmatter Fields
docs.text: Field Required Description name Yes Lowercase a-z, 0-9, - only. Must match directory name. description Yes What it does AND when to use it (max 1024 chars). allowed-tools No Space-delimited pre-approved tool patterns.

docs.title: Distribution
docs.text:
uv run .ai-workspace/scripts/transpile-skills.py             # Validate + distribute
uv run .ai-workspace/scripts/transpile-skills.py --validate  # Validate only

docs.title: Supported Tools
docs.text: Tool Discovery Path Notes Claude Code .claude/skills/ Native discovery; symlinked from skills/ OpenCode .opencode/skill/ Native discovery; symlinked via transpile Roo Code skills/ Native discovery

docs.title: Tool Discovery
docs.text: Tool Discovery automatically detects installed CLI tools on the user's system and injects them into the AI agent's session context. This ensures agents know which tools are available and how to use them.

docs.title: Defining Tools
docs.text:
Tools are defined in agent-tools.yaml at the repository root.

- id: github
  command: gh
  name: GitHub CLI
  description: GitHub CLI for repository operations, issues, PRs, and CI/CD.
  when_to_use: |
    - Working with GitHub-hosted repositories
    - Fetching issues, PRs, or checking CI status
  instructions: |
    Common commands:
    - Issues: gh issue list, gh issue view <num>
    - PRs: gh pr list, gh pr create

docs.title: Fields
docs.text: Field Required Description id Yes Unique identifier for the tool command Yes CLI command to check for (e.g., gh) name Yes Human-readable display name description Yes What the tool does when_to_use Yes Conditions under which agents should use this tool instructions No Usage examples and common commands

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
In ai-workspace.toml:

[tools]
show_unavailable = false  # Only show available tools (default)
